page.title: 12TRANSPORTATION
page.content: The main{road}and{rail}routes run parallel to the coast.Recently there has been redevelopment of the main road system with the up-grading of the A8 to duel carriageway status. This means that there is a continuous fast road link to Glasgow and Greenock. In doing so the land around and on which the road travels has had to be carved,reclaimed and landscaped to hide the scars.The road is used by the council run bus service and light {transportation}lorries that can deliver goods to all parts of Scotland.The 3 Port Glasgow train stations provide a service to Wemyss Bay,Gourock and Glasgow.The service is regular,fast and although limited is more efficient than the bus service can ever be.{Communications}have certainly improved over the years.
